rounds k around round 2 *yo ssk k2tog yo k1 repeat from * around round 4 *k1 yo ssk k3 k2tog yo k2 repeat from * around round 6 *k2 yo ssk k1 k2tog yo k3 repeat from * around round 8 *k3 yo s1k2p yo k4 repeat from * around rounds 10 12 and 14 *ssk k2 yo k1 yo k2 k2tog k1 repeat from * around repeat rounds 1-14 two more cid 415 mes then work rounds 1-8 k around for 5 rounds time to decrease you may want to switch to magic loop or dpns at this point round 1 k2tog k8 around 90 sts round 2 k2tog k7 around 80 sts round 3 k2tog k6 around 70 sts round 4 k2tog k5 around 60 sts round 5 k2tog k4 around 50 sts round 6 k2tog k3 around 40 sts round 7 k2tog k2 around 30 sts round 8 k2tog around 15 sts cut yarn and thread a yarn needle with the end run the yarn end through each of the sts and pull cid 415 ghtly closed like a drawstring tie off to secure and weave in all ends i chose to steam block my hat but if you prefer more open lace and a looser fit you could opt to wet block cong cid 162
